question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What university was Paul De Decker attending in 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unlikely Path to Success: Paul De Decker's Journey

In the heart of Belgium, where the scent of waffles and chocolate wafts through the air, a young Paul De Decker was forging his path to become a renowned businessperson. Born and raised in a country steeped in history and tradition, Paul's entrepreneurial spirit was ignited at a tender age. Little did he know that his fate would be intertwined with one of Belgium's most prestigious institutions â€“ Vlerick Business School. As a bright-eyed and ambitious individual, Paul was determined to make a name for himself in the business world. He knew that to succeed, he needed to equip himself with the right tools and knowledge. It was during this period of self-discovery that Paul stumbled upon Vlerick Business School, an institution that would change the trajectory of his life forever. Founded in 1953, Vlerick Business School was already an established name in the Belgian business landscape. With its strong reputation for academic excellence and innovative approach to business education, Paul knew that this was the perfect place to hone his skills. He applied to the school, and after a rigorous selection process, he was accepted into the program. Paul's time at Vlerick Business School was a transformative experience. He was immersed in a world of cutting-edge business theories, case studies, and real-world applications. The school's emphasis on entrepreneurship, innovation, and sustainability resonated deeply with Paul's values and aspirations. Under the guidance of experienced professors and industry experts, Paul's business acumen began to take shape. One of the most significant aspects of Paul's education at Vlerick was the opportunity to engage with a diverse community of students and professionals. The school's strong industry connections and global network provided Paul with a platform to build relationships that would last a lifetime. He was exposed to various business models, cultural nuances, and market trends, which broadened his perspective and prepared him for the complexities of the global business landscape. As Paul progressed through the program, he became increasingly fascinated with the art of leadership and the role of business in society. He was particularly drawn to the works of renowned business thinkers and practitioners, such as Peter Drucker and C.K. Prahalad, who emphasized the importance of innovation, social responsibility, and customer-centricity. These influences would later shape Paul's approach to business and inform his decision-making processes.
content.source_2: In the year 2026, the world was on the cusp of a technological revolution. Cities were transforming into smart metropolises, and the boundaries of human innovation were being pushed to new limits. Amidst this backdrop of rapid progress, a young Paul De Decker from Belgium set foot on the sun-kissed campus of the University of California, Davis. It was January 3rd, a crisp winter morning, and Paul was eager to embark on a journey that would shape his future as a businessperson. As he settled into his dorm room, Paul couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement and trepidation. The next nine years would be a whirlwind of academic rigor, personal growth, and self-discovery. He threw himself into his studies, determined to make the most of his time at UC Davis. The early years flew by in a blur of lectures, assignments, and group projects. Paul thrived in the university's vibrant atmosphere, making friends and connections that would last a lifetime. He was particularly drawn to the fields of entrepreneurship and sustainability, and his passion for innovation earned him recognition among his peers. As the years went by, Paul's interests began to shift towards the intersection of technology and business. He spent countless hours in the university's state-of-the-art labs, working on projects that aimed to disrupt traditional industries and create a more sustainable future. His dedication and perseverance paid off, and he soon found himself at the forefront of a burgeoning startup scene in Davis. The summer of 2032 was a turning point in Paul's life. He landed an internship at a cutting-edge tech firm in Silicon Valley, where he worked alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry. The experience not only honed his skills but also opened doors to a network of influential professionals who would become valuable mentors and allies in the years to come. As Paul entered the final stretch of his academic journey, he began to reflect on the incredible journey he had been on. From the nervous freshman who had stepped onto campus in 2026 to the confident, driven individual he had become, Paul had undergone a transformation that would stay with him for the rest of his life. On March 4th, 2035, Paul De Decker walked out of the University of California, Davis, armed with a degree, a wealth of knowledge, and a burning desire to make a difference in the world.
